meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to establish a registration scheme for food importers and food distributors; to require the keeping of records by persons who acquire, capture, import or supply food; to enable food import controls to be imposed; to re-enact Part VA of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132); to make consequential and related amendments to that Ordinance and another Ordinance and to provide for incidental and connected matters.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Food Safety Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance—
subsection.def: air transhipment cargo (航空轉運貨物) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Import and Export Ordinance (Cap. 60);
aquatic product (水產) means fish, shellfish, amphibian or any other form of aquatic life other than a bird, mammal or reptile;

def.name: AuthorizedOfficer
def.leadIn: authorized officer (獲授權人員), in relation to a provision of this Ordinance, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public officer authorized under section 39 in relation to that provision; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a public officer authorized under section 39 in relation to this Ordinance generally;

def.name: Drink
def.leadIn: drink (飲品) does not include water other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: aerated water;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: distilled water;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: water from natural springs, either in its natural state or with added mineral substances; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: water that is placed in a sealed container and is intended for human consumption;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: drink;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ice;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: chewing gum and other products of a similar nature and use;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: smokeless tobacco products; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: articles and substances used as ingredients in the preparation of food,

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: live animals or live birds, other than live aquatic products;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: fodder or feeding stuffs for animals, birds or aquatic products; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: medicine as defined by section 2(1) of the Pharmacy and Poisons Ordinance (Cap. 138) or Chinese herbal medicine or proprietary Chinese medicine as defined by section 2(1) of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549);

subsection.def: food distribution business (食物分銷業務) means a business the principal activity of which is the supply of food in Hong Kong by wholesale; Note— See also subsection (2).
food distributor (食物分銷商) means a person who carries on a food distribution business;
food importation business (食物進口業務) means a business that imports food (whether or not that is the principal activity of the business);
food importer (食物進口商) means a person who carries on a food importation business;
food safety order (食物安全命令) means an order made under section 30 as varied from time to time under section 30(5);
food transport operator (食物運輸商) means a person who transports food under a contract of carriage but at no time has any proprietary interest in the food;
function (職能) includes duty;
local aquatic product (本地水產) means an aquatic product captured from a local fishing vessel, whether in Hong Kong waters or in other waters;

local fishing vessel (本地漁船) means a Class III vessel (within the meaning of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Certification and Licensing) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. D)) that is licensed under that Regulation;
registered food distributor (登記食物分銷商) means a person who is registered under Part 2 as a food distributor;
registered food importer (登記食物進口商) means a person who is registered under Part 2 as a food importer;
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Environment and Ecology; (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)
smokeless tobacco product (無煙煙草產品) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132);

def.name: Supply
def.leadIn: supply (供應), in relation to food, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to sell the food;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to offer, keep or exhibit the food for sale;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to exchange or dispose of the food for consideration; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for commercial purposes, to give the food as a prize or to make a gift of the food;

subsection.def: wholesale (批發) means the supply of food to a person who obtains the food for the purpose of supplying or causing to supply it to a third party in the course of business carried on by that person.

subsection.content: In determining, for the purposes of the definition of food distribution business in subsection (1), whether the principal activity of a business is the supply of food in Hong Kong by wholesale, regard must be had only to those activities of the business that are related to the supply of food.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Food not intended for human consumption

subsection.content: This Ordinance does not apply in relation to any food that is not intended for human consumption.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any food commonly used for human consumption is presumed, unless there is evidence to the contrary, to be intended for human consumption;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any substance capable of being used in the composition or preparation of any food commonly used for human consumption that is found on any premises or in any vessel where that food is prepared is presumed, unless there is evidence to the contrary, to be intended for human consumption.

subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (1) or (2), this Ordinance does not apply in relation to the propagation or promotion of growth of live aquatic products in captivity.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Registration of Food Importers and Distributors

section.name: s4
section.heading: Requirement for food importers to be registered

subsection.content: A person must not carry on a food importation business unless the person is registered under this Part as a food importer in respect of that business.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is specified in column 4 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is exempted, or is in a class of persons that is exempted, under section 6 in respect of the business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: food is imported solely for the purpose of export, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the food is air transhipment cargo; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: during the period between import and export, the food remains in the vessel, vehicle or aircraft in which it was imported; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: food is imported solely in the course of business of a food transport operator.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Requirement for food distributors to be registered

subsection.content: A person must not carry on a food distribution business unless the person is registered under this Part as a food distributor in respect of that business.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is specified in column 4 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is exempted, or is in a class of persons that is exempted, under section 6 in respect of the business; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person is registered under this Part as a food importer in respect of the business.

subsection.content: The Director may in writing exempt a person from the requirement to be registered under this Part in respect of a business.
An exemption under subsection (1) may be granted subject to any conditions the Director considers appropriate.
The Director may withdraw an exemption granted under subsection (1) on the ground that the conditions of the exemption have not been complied with.
The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, exempt a class of persons from the requirement to be registered under this Part in respect of a class of businesses.

subsection.leadIn: A person may apply to the Director to be registered under this Part in respect of a business—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as a food importer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as a food distributor.

subsection.content: For a partnership, a partner authorized by the partnership may apply for registration on behalf of the partnership and, if registration is granted, it is to be expressed to be granted to that person on behalf of the partnership.

subsection.leadIn: An application for registration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the form specified by the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must identify the main food categories and food classifications, as set out in Schedule 2, of all food to be imported by the business (for a food importer) or supplied by wholesale by the business (for a food distributor);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must include or be accompanied by any documents or information reasonably required by the Director for the purpose of considering the application; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must be made in the manner specified by the Director.

subsection.content: The Director may refuse to consider an application that does not comply with subsection (3).
The Director must decide whether to grant or refuse an application for registration under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may refuse an application if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that the applicant has repeatedly contravened this Ordinance in the period of 12 months immediately preceding the day on which the application was made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant was previously registered under this Part in respect of the business and that registration was revoked in the period of 12 months immediately preceding the day on which the application was made; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of an application on behalf of a partnership, the registration under this Part of any partner on behalf of the partnership in respect of the business was revoked in the period of 12 months immediately preceding the day on which the application was made.

subsection.content: The Director must give written notice to the applicant of the Director’s decision on the application.
If the Director refuses an application, the notice must include the reasons for refusal.
If the Director grants an application for registration under this Part, the Director must register the applicant on payment of the registration fee specified in Schedule 3.
On registration, the Director must assign a registration number and inform the applicant of that number.
Unless revoked earlier, registration has effect for a period of 3 years, and may be renewed in accordance with this Part.
Registration under this Part is non-transferable.
The Director may impose any conditions on a person’s registration under this Part that the Director considers appropriate.
Conditions may be imposed under subsection (1) only at the time of registration or renewal of registration.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes a condition of registration commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.
A registered food importer or registered food distributor may apply for renewal of registration under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: An application for renewal of registration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the form specified by the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must include or be accompanied by any documents or information reasonably required by the Director for the purpose of considering the application; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: no earlier than 4 months before the day on which the registration is due to expire; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the manner specified by the Director.

subsection.content: The Director may refuse to consider an application that does not comply with subsection (2).

If an application is made in accordance with this section but the Director has not made a decision on the application before the day on which the registration is due to expire, the registration continues in effect until it is renewed under section 13 or the Director gives notice to the applicant of the Director’s decision to refuse the application.
The Director must decide whether to grant or refuse an application for renewal of registration under this Part.

The Director may refuse an application if the Director is satisfied that the applicant has repeatedly contravened this Ordinance in the period of 12 months immediately preceding the day on which the application was made.
The Director must give written notice to the applicant of the Director’s decision on the application.
If the Director refuses an application, the notice must include the reasons for refusal.
If the Director grants an application for renewal of registration under this Part, the Director must renew the registration on payment of the renewal fee specified in Schedule 3.

subsection.leadIn: Renewal of registration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect on the expiry of the current registration or at the time of renewal, whichever is later; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless revoked earlier, has effect for a period of 3 years.

subsection.content: Registration under this Part may be renewed more than once.
The Director may revoke a person’s registration under this Part in respect of a business at the person’s request.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may also revoke a person’s registration under this Part in respect of a business if the Director is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has repeatedly contravened this Ordinance in respect of that business in the previous 12 month period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a natural person, the person has died; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a business carried on by a corporation or partnership, the corporation has been wound up or the partnership has been dissolved.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must not revoke a person’s registration under subsection (2)(a) unless the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: gives written notice to the person of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Director’s intention to revoke the registration; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the grounds for revocation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permits the person to make written representations to the Director within the period specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: considers any representations made within that period by the person.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director revokes a person’s registration under subsection (2)(a), the Director must give written notice to the person as soon as practicable, specifying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reasons for the revocation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the day on which the revocation takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: Revocation of registration takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for revocation under subsection (1), on the day determined by the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for revocation under subsection (2), on the expiry of 30 days after the day on which the decision to revoke the registration is made.

subsection.content: The Director must keep a register of registered food importers and registered food distributors.

subsection.leadIn: The register must contain, in relation to each registered food importer and registered food distributor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the food importation business or food distribution business;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration number;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any change in the information referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other information the Director considers appropriate for the implementation of this Ordinance and any change in that information.

subsection.content: The register may be kept in a form the Director considers appropriate, including in a form other than a documentary form as long as the information recorded under subsection (2) is capable of being reproduced in a legible form.
For the purpose of enabling members of the public to ascertain whether a person is registered under this Part, the Director must make the register available for public inspection.

subsection.leadIn: At all reasonable times, a member of the public may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect the register without charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obtain a copy of an entry in or extract from the register on payment of the fee specified in Schedule 3.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Appeals to Municipal Services Appeals Board

subsection.content: A person who is aggrieved by a decision of the Director under this Part may, within 28 days after becoming aware of the decision, appeal to the Municipal Services Appeals Board against the decision.
An appeal under this section does not suspend the decision unless the Director decides otherwise.

A person who is a registered food importer or registered food distributor must give written notice to the Director of any change in the information provided to the Director in, or in relation to, the person’s application for registration or renewal of registration, within 30 days after the change occurs.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to give notice to the Director under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes in a notice information that the person knows is false in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: recklessly includes in a notice information that is false in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

The Director may request a specified Authority to provide any specified information held by the specified Authority in relation to a specified authorization issued or granted by the specified Authority.
A request under subsection (1) must be made in writing.
A specified Authority must comply with a request of the Director under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified Authority (指明當局), in relation to a specified authorization, means the person specified in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite that authorization;
specified authorization (指明授權) means a licence, permit, permission or registration specified in column 2 of Schedule 1;

specified information (指明資料) means information that a person to whom a specified authorization is issued or granted would be required to provide to the Director in, or in relation to, an application for registration or renewal of registration under this Part if the person were required to be so registered.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Obtaining information from persons who are not registered

subsection.content: The Director may require a person who carries on a food importation business or a business that supplies food in Hong Kong by wholesale but who is not registered under this Part in respect of that business to provide any information that the person would be required to provide to the Director in, or in relation to, an application for registration or renewal of registration under this Part if the person were required to be so registered.
A requirement under subsection (1) must be made in writing.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement made under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in purported compliance with a requirement made under subsection (1)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: provides information that the person knows is false in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: recklessly provides information that is false in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Providing false information in relation to registration or renewal

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if in, or in relation to, an application for registration or renewal of registration under this Part, the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provides information or a document that the person knows is false in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recklessly provides information or a document that is false in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Record of local acquisition of food

subsection.leadIn: A person who, in the course of business, acquires food in Hong Kong must record the following information about the acquisition of the food—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date the food was acquired;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and contact details of the person from whom the food was acquired;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the total quantity of the food;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a description of the food.

subsection.content: A record must be made under this section within 72 hours after the time the food was acquired.
For the purposes of this section, food is acquired when the person acquiring it takes possession or control of the food.
This section does not apply to a person who is exempted, or is in a class of persons that is exempted, under section 29.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to make a record in accordance with this section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes in a record information that the person knows is false in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: recklessly includes in a record information that is false in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (5) is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Record of acquisition of imported food

subsection.leadIn: A person who, in the course of business, imports food must record the following information about the acquisition of the food—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date the food was acquired;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and contact details of the person from whom the food was acquired;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the place from where the food was imported;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the total quantity of the food;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a description of the food.

subsection.content: A record must be made under this section at or before the time the food is imported.
For the purposes of this section, food is acquired when the person acquiring it takes possession or control of the food.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a person who is exempted, or is in a class of persons that is exempted, under section 29;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to an acquisition of food that is imported solely for the purpose of exporting it, if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the food is air transhipment cargo; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: during the period between import and export, the food remains in the vessel, vehicle or aircraft in which it was imported; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to an acquisition of food that is imported solely in the course of business of a food transport operator.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to make a record in accordance with this section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes in a record information that the person knows is false in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: recklessly includes in a record information that is false in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (5) is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who captures local aquatic products and who, in the course of business, supplies them in Hong Kong must record the following information about the capture—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date or period of the capture;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the common name of the local aquatic products;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the total quantity of the local aquatic products;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the area of the capture.

subsection.content: A record must be made under this section at or before the time the supply takes place.
This section does not apply to a person who is exempted, or is in a class of persons that is exempted, under section 29.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to make a record in accordance with this section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes in a record information that the person knows is false in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: recklessly includes in a record information that is false in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Record of wholesale supply of food

subsection.leadIn: A person who, in the course of business, supplies food in Hong Kong by wholesale must record the following information about the supply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date the food was supplied;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and contact details of the person to whom the food was supplied;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the total quantity of the food;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a description of the food.

subsection.content: A record must be made under this section within 72 hours after the time the supply took place.
This section does not apply to a person who is exempted, or is in a class of persons that is exempted, under section 29.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to make a record in accordance with this section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes in a record information that the person knows is false in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: recklessly includes in a record information that is false in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under section 24(4)(a) in relation to a supply of food to show that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s normal business is the supply of food by retail; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it was reasonable for the person to assume that the supply was not a wholesale supply.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: retail (零售) means the supply of food to a person who obtains it other than for the purpose of wholesale.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Duration of Keeping Records and their Inspection

subsection.content:
A person must keep a record made under this Part (other than a record relating to live aquatic products) for the period specified in the following table—
Column 1
Column 2
Shelf-life of food
Period for which record must be kept
3 months or less
3 months after the date the food was acquired, captured or supplied
Greater than 3 months
24 months after the date the food was acquired, captured or supplied
A person must keep a record made under this Part relating to live aquatic products for a period of 3 months after the date the products were acquired, captured or supplied.

A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to keep a record for the period specified in subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: shelf-life (保質期), in relation to food, means the period during which the food maintains its microbiological safety and sensory qualities at a specific storage temperature as determined by the supplier of the food.

subsection.content: A person must produce for inspection any record required to be kept by the person under this Part when required to do so by the Director or an authorized officer.
The Director or authorized officer may make a copy of or take an extract from a record produced by the person.
The person must provide any assistance reasonably required by the Director or authorized officer to understand or interpret a record produced by the person.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Use and disclosure of records by Director

subsection.content: The Director may use a record produced under section 27, or any information contained in the record, for the purpose of exercising powers or performing functions under this Ordinance.

The Director may disclose to the public any information contained in a record produced under section 27 if the Director is satisfied that public disclosure of the information is necessary for the protection of public health.
The Director may in writing exempt a person from the requirement to keep a record under this Part.
An exemption under subsection (1) may be granted subject to any conditions the Director considers appropriate.
The Director may withdraw an exemption granted under subsection (1) on the ground that the conditions of the exemption have not been complied with.
The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, exempt a class of persons from the requirement to keep a record under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may make an order to do any one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibit the import of any food for the period specified in the order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prohibit the supply of any food for the period specified in the order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: direct that any food supplied be recalled and specify the manner in which, and the period within which, the recall is to be conducted;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: direct that any food be impounded, isolated, destroyed or otherwise disposed of and specify the manner in which, and the period within which, the impounding, isolation, destruction or disposal is to be conducted;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: prohibit the carrying on of an activity in relation to any food, or permit the carrying on of any such activity in accordance with conditions specified in the order, for the period specified in the order.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may only make a food safety order if the Director has reasonable grounds at the time of making the order to believe that the making of the order is necessary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to prevent or reduce a possibility of danger to public health; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to mitigate any adverse consequence of a danger to public health.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether there are reasonable grounds under subsection (2), the Director may, in so far as is practicable and reasonable, take into account all factors relevant to the circumstances of the case that the Director considers appropriate, including but not limited to the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information obtained from any importer or supplier of the food;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: information, reports or testing results obtained from a public analyst;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: information (including reports, alerts, warnings and advisories) obtained from any international food or health authority or the food or health authority of any place;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the time required for obtaining reports or testing results from a public analyst;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: characteristics of any hazard in the food, the level of the hazard in the food, consumption pattern of the food and the exposure of the general public and vulnerable groups to the food;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any statutory requirement relating to the food;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: information on the source and extent of the hazard, in particular on whether the hazard exists throughout or in any part of the manufacture or supply chain or is limited to a particular batch of food.

subsection.leadIn: A food safety order must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person, persons or class of persons intended to be bound by the order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of the food that is the subject of the order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reason for making the order and the principal factors that led to the making of the order;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the prohibition or action required, as the case may be, and conditions (if any) under the order;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the period referred to in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e), as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the provision under which the order is made and the consequences of a contravention of any term of the order.

subsection.content: The Director may, in the same manner as a food safety order was made, vary or revoke the order, and section 31 applies, with the necessary modifications, in relation to the variation or revocation of a food safety order under this subsection as it applies in relation to a food safety order.
A food safety order is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: hazard (危害) means a biological, chemical or physical agent in, or condition of, food with the potential to cause an adverse health effect;
public analyst (政府分析員) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132).

section.name: s31
section.heading: Manner of making food safety orders, service and publication

subsection.leadIn: A food safety order must be in writing and may be addressed to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a particular person or particular persons;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a class of persons; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all persons.

subsection.leadIn: A food safety order addressed to a particular person or particular persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be served on that person, or each of those persons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: takes effect in relation to a person when it is served on that person.

subsection.leadIn: A food safety order addressed to a class of persons or all persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be published in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: takes effect at the time specified in the order.

subsection.content: A food safety order is binding on the person or persons to whom it is addressed.
A person bound by a food safety order who contravenes a term of the order commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.
It is not a defence for the person to show that the food concerned is the subject of a licence, permit or any other form of authorization issued or granted under this or any other Ordinance.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Actions taken in relation to food safety orders and provision of samples

subsection.leadIn: The Director may serve on a person bound by a food safety order a notice requiring the person (at the time or times, or within the period, specified in the notice) to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the Director of the actions taken by the person in relation to the order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide to the Director samples of the food that is the subject of the order, in the quantity specified in the notice, for analysis, or for bacteriological or other examination.

subsection.content: If a sample of food is provided to the Director in compliance with a notice under subsection (1)(b), the Director must pay to the person appearing to have the lawful custody of the food the market price of the sample or, if the market price is unknown or not readily ascertainable, a reasonable price.

subsection.leadIn: A person on whom a notice has been served under subsection (1) commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in purported compliance with the notice—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: provides information that the person knows is false in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: recklessly provides information that is false in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Power to obtain information or copies of documents

subsection.leadIn: If the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that a person possesses any information or document that may assist the Director in deciding whether to make, vary or revoke a food safety order, the Director may serve on the person a notice requiring the person to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide the information specified in the notice within the period specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produce the document specified in the notice at the time and place specified in the notice and permit an authorized officer to make copies of the document at that time and place.

subsection.leadIn: A person on whom a notice has been served under subsection (1) commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in purported compliance with the notice—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: provides information or produces a document that the person knows is false in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: recklessly provides information or produces a document that is false in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Appeals to Municipal Services Appeals Board

subsection.content: A person bound by a food safety order who is aggrieved by the order may, within 28 days after becoming bound by the order, appeal to the Municipal Services Appeals Board against the order as originally made.

A person bound by a food safety order who is aggrieved by a variation of the order under section 30(5) may, within 28 days after becoming bound by the variation, appeal to the Municipal Services Appeals Board against the order as so varied.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of an appeal against a food safety order addressed as referred to in section 31(1)(b) or (c), if the Municipal Services Appeals Board Ordinance (Cap. 220) authorizes or requires any document to be served or any notice to be given to the persons bound by the order, the document may be served or the notice may be given by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publication in the Gazette; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other means specified by the Chairman of the Municipal Services Appeals Board by notice in writing signed by the Chairman.

subsection.content: An appeal under this section does not suspend the food safety order unless the Director decides otherwise.

A person bound by a food safety order may apply for an amount of compensation, recoverable as a civil debt due from the Government, that is just and equitable in all the circumstances of the case, for any loss of a kind set out in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The person is entitled to compensation only if the person proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director did not have reasonable grounds to make the order at the time of making the order or to vary the order at the time of a variation of the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has suffered the relevant loss.

subsection.leadIn: The losses referred to in subsection (1) are the following losses arising as a direct result of compliance with the food safety order or as a direct result of the exercise of a power under section 37(1) in relation to the food safety order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: total or partial loss of the food that is the subject of the order and that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has been destroyed or otherwise disposed of;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is no longer fit for human consumption; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is depreciated in value;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: costs or expenditure actually and directly incurred.

subsection.leadIn: The amount of compensation recoverable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a loss of a kind set out in subsection (3)(a), must not exceed the market value of the food immediately before the time of making the food safety order or immediately before the time of the variation, as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a loss of a kind set out in subsection (3)(b), must not exceed the actual amount of the costs or expenditure incurred.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the Small Claims Tribunal, for claims up to the maximum jurisdiction of the Tribunal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the District Court, irrespective of the amount claimed.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Seizure, marking or destruction of food

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to an authorized officer that a term of a food safety order has been contravened by a person bound by the order in respect of any food, the officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: seize and remove from the person any of the food or any package in which it is contained;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: affix to any of the food that is in the person’s possession a mark, seal or other designation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: destroy or otherwise dispose of any of the food that is in the person’s possession or cause it to be destroyed or otherwise disposed of.

subsection.content: The Director may, in a court of competent jurisdiction, recover from a person referred to in subsection (1) any reasonable costs incurred under subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c) as if those costs were a debt due to the Director from that person.

Before an authorized officer destroys or otherwise disposes of any food or causes any food to be destroyed or otherwise disposed of under subsection (1)(c), the authorized officer must record a description and other details that are sufficient to identify the food.
The Director must keep a record made under subsection (3) for a period of not less than 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: If a court convicts a person of an offence under this Part, the court may order that any one or more of the following is forfeited—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any food to which the conviction relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any similar food found on the person’s premises or in the person’s possession at the time of the commission of the offence or of the seizure of the food to which the conviction relates;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any package in which food referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) is contained.

subsection.content: Any food or package forfeited under subsection (5) may be disposed of in the manner specified by the Director.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Offence to tamper with mark, seal or other designation

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to deceive another person, removes, alters or obliterates a mark, seal or other designation affixed under section 37(1)(b).
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
The Director may authorize a public officer to be an authorized officer for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: An authorization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be given in relation to specified provisions of this Ordinance or in relation to this Ordinance generally.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Delegation by Director
section.content: The Director may in writing delegate any function or power of the Director under this Ordinance to a public officer or class of public officers.

subsection.content: Except as provided by subsection (2), a public officer must not disclose or give to another person any information concerning a trade, business or manufacturing secret that has come to the knowledge of, or into the possession of, the public officer in the course of the public officer’s exercise of powers or performance of functions under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A public officer may disclose or give to another person information referred to in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the public officer’s exercise of powers or performance of functions under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under an order of a court under subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: with the consent in writing of all persons who appear to the public officer, after reasonable inquiry, to be interested in the confidentiality of the information.

subsection.content: If in any proceedings a court considers that the justice of the case so requires, the court may order the disclosure of information referred to in subsection (1).
A public officer who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a public officer charged with an offence under this section to show that at the time of the alleged offence the defendant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: believed that there was lawful authority for the defendant to disclose or give the information to the other person and the defendant had no reasonable cause to believe otherwise; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: did not know and had no reasonable cause to believe that the information disclosed or given was information referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.content: A public officer is not personally liable for anything done or omitted to be done by the public officer in good faith in the exercise of a power or performance of a function or purported exercise of a power or purported performance of a function under this Ordinance.
The protection conferred by subsection (1) does not affect any liability of the Government for the act or omission.
The Director may issue any code of practice that in the Director’s opinion is suitable for providing practical guidance in respect of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If a code of practice is issued under subsection (1), the Director must, by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the code;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the code is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify for which of the provisions of this Ordinance the code is issued.

subsection.content: The Director may from time to time revise the whole or any part of a code of practice issued under subsection (1).
Subsection (2) applies, with the necessary modifications, in relation to any revision made under subsection (3) as it applies in relation to the issue of a code of practice.
The Director may at any time revoke a code of practice issued under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: If a code of practice is revoked under subsection (5), the Director must, by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the code; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the revocation is to take effect.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Use of codes of practice in legal proceedings

subsection.content: A failure by a person to observe a provision of a code of practice does not of itself render the person liable to any civil or criminal proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: However, if in any legal proceedings the court is satisfied that a provision of a code of practice is relevant to determining a matter that is in issue in the proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the code of practice is admissible in evidence in the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof that the person contravened, or did not contravene, the provision may be relied on by any party to the proceedings as tending to establish or negate that matter.

subsection.content: In any legal proceedings, a code of practice that appears to the court to be the subject of a notice under section 43 is to be taken to be the subject of that notice in the absence of evidence to the contrary.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: code of practice (實務守則) means a code of practice issued under section 43 as revised from time to time under section 43(3);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a court as defined by section 3 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a magistrate; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Municipal Services Appeals Board;

subsection.def: legal proceedings (法律程序) includes proceedings of the Municipal Services Appeals Board on an appeal under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has reasonable grounds to suspect that a provision of this Ordinance has been contravened; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has reasonable grounds to believe that a person has information or a document relating to the contravention.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may serve on the person a notice requiring the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide, within the period specified in the notice, information of a kind specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to produce, at the time and place specified in the notice, any document in the person’s possession or control of a kind specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (2), the kinds of information or documents that may be specified in a notice under that subsection include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information or documents indicating whether or not a person is a food importer or food distributor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: information or documents relating to any transaction relating to food;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any information contained, or required to be contained, in an application for registration or renewal of registration under Part 2;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any documents accompanying, or required to accompany, such an application; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any other information or documents provided, or required to be provided, in relation to such an application.

subsection.leadIn: A person on whom a notice has been served under subsection (2) commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in purported compliance with the notice—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: provides information or produces a document that the person knows is false in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: recklessly provides information or produces a document that is false in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer may enter any premises or vessel used for business purposes at any time during which business is carried on, for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the enforcement of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the exercise of any power or the performance of any function of the authorized officer or the Director under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: On entry, the authorized officer must produce evidence of his or her written authorization under section 39, if so required.

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may, by warrant, authorize an authorized officer to enter, by force if necessary, any premises or vessel referred to in section 46(1) for a purpose referred to in that section if the magistrate is satisfied on sworn information in writing that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: admission to the premises or vessel has been refused or refusal is apprehended; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is reasonable ground for entry to the premises or vessel for a purpose referred to in section 46(1).

subsection.content: A warrant must be in the form specified in Schedule 4.
A warrant continues in force until the purpose for which the entry is necessary has been satisfied.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Assistance for authorized officers on entry
section.content: An authorized officer entering premises or a vessel under section 46 or 47 may be accompanied by any persons the authorized officer considers necessary.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Power of arrest in certain cases

subsection.content: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a person has committed or is committing an offence under an enactment specified in Schedule 5, the authorized officer may arrest the person without a warrant.
If a person forcibly resists the attempt of an authorized officer to arrest him or her or attempts to evade arrest, the authorized officer may use all reasonable means necessary to make the arrest.

If an authorized officer arrests a person under this section, the authorized officer must immediately take the person to the nearest police station or hand the person over to the custody of a police officer, to be dealt with in accordance with the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232).

subsection.leadIn: If the Director or an authorized officer comes into possession of any property under this Ordinance, section 102 of the Criminal Procedure Ordinance (Cap. 221) applies as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director or authorized officer were the police within the meaning of that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the property were property that had come into the possession of the police in connection with an offence.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply if the manner of disposal of the property is provided for by another provision of this Ordinance.

If an offence under this Ordinance by a body corporate is proved to have been committed with the consent or connivance of an officer of the body corporate, the officer also commits the offence and is liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Officer
def.leadIn: officer (人員), of a body corporate, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person purporting to act in the capacity of a person referred to in paragraph (a); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the affairs of the body corporate are managed by its members, a member of the body corporate who is concerned in the management of the body corporate.

subsection.content: An act done or omission made by an employee in the course of employment is to be treated for the purposes of this Ordinance as done or made by the employer, as well as by the employee.

An act done or omission made by an agent of another person with the authority (whether express or implied and whether precedent or subsequent) of that other person is to be treated for the purposes of this Ordinance as done or made by that other person, as well as by the agent.

In a proceeding for an offence under section 4, 5, 21(5)(a), 22(5)(a), 23(4)(a), 24(4)(a), 26(3) or 32(1) brought against a person in respect of an act or omission alleged to have been done or made by an employee or agent of the person, the person is liable to be convicted of and be punished for that offence unless the person establishes the defence described in subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: If a proceeding is brought against a person by virtue of subsection (3), it is a defence for the person to show that the person exercised all due diligence to prevent the employee or agent from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: doing the act or making the omission; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: doing an act or making an omission of that description in the course of the employee’s employment or the agent’s authority.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Defence for employees
section.leadIn: It is a defence for an employee charged with an offence under this Ordinance to show that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the act or omission of the employee was done or made in the course of the employee’s employment and under instructions given by the employer in the course of that employment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the employee was not, at the relevant time, in a position to make or influence a decision regarding that act or omission.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Obstruction of persons performing official functions etc.

subsection.content: A person who wilfully obstructs, resists or uses abusive language to a person who is performing functions under this Ordinance, or under an order made or warrant issued under this Ordinance, commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the conduct constitutes an offence against another provision of this Ordinance.

If proceedings under this Ordinance are competent against several persons in respect of their joint act or default, any one or more of them may be proceeded against without proceeding against the others.

subsection.leadIn: If an offence consists of a failure to comply with a notice served by a public officer under this Ordinance and a similar notice was served on several persons in respect of the same matter—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any one or more of the persons may be proceeded against without proceeding against the others; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if more than one person is proceeded against, the court may treat them as if they were joint offenders.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Time limit for prosecutions
section.content: Despite section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), a complaint may be made or an information laid in respect of an offence under this Ordinance within 6 months after the offence is discovered by, or comes to the notice of, the Director.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Method of giving or serving notice
section.leadIn: The Director may give a notice or other document to a person, or serve a notice or other document on a person, under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering it to the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by sending it by registered post addressed to the last known place of business or residence of the person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by leaving it with an adult occupier of that place or posting it in a prominent position at that place.

subsection.content: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1, 3 or 4.
The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 2.
The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 5.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for any matters that are necessary for giving full effect to the purposes and provisions of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prohibiting, restricting or regulating the importation of food of a specified class; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: generally for the better carrying out of the purposes and provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under subsection (1) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for a particular case or class of cases;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made so as to apply only in the circumstances prescribed by the regulations;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify forms for the purposes of the regulations; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prescribe offences for contraventions of the regulations, punishable by a fine, imprisonment or both.

subsection.content: The maximum fine that may be prescribed for an offence is level 6 and the maximum imprisonment is 6 months. In addition, in the case of a continuing offence, a further fine not exceeding $1,500 for each day during which the offence continues may be prescribed.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under subsection (1) may—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: permit the importation of food of a specified class subject to any conditions the health officer may specify;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: require imported food of a specified class to be submitted or made available for inspection by a health inspector;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: impose any conditions or issue any directions with regard to imported food of a specified class as may appear to the health officer desirable for the purpose of ensuring that the food is sound, wholesome or fit for human consumption; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prohibit the contravention of any condition, requirement or direction referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: health inspector (衞生督察) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132);
health officer (衞生主任) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132).

section.name: s60
section.heading: Transitional provision—registration before commencement of Division 1 of Part 2
section.content: Despite section 9(3), if a food importer or food distributor is registered under Part 2 before the date on which Division 1 of that Part commences*, the registration has effect, unless revoked earlier, for the period ending 3 years after that date.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Transitional provision—orders under section 78B of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance
section.content: An order in force under section 78B of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132) immediately before the date on which section 68 of this Ordinance commences* remains in force on and after that date in accordance with its terms as if it were a food safety order and may be varied or revoked accordingly.

subsection.content: Section 21 applies to food that is acquired on or after the date on which that section commences*.
Section 22 applies to food that is imported on or after the date on which that section commences* whether the food was acquired before, on or after that date.
Section 23 applies to local aquatic products that are supplied on or after the date on which that section commences* whether the local aquatic products were captured before, on or after that date.
Section 24 applies to food that is supplied by wholesale on or after the date on which that section commences*.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Transitional provision—ice-making factories
section.content: During the period of 6 months beginning on the date on which section 64(2) commences*, a person does not commit an offence under section 35 of the Food Business Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. X) for a contravention of section 31(1) of that Regulation only because the person carries on, or causes, permits or suffers to be carried on, a business that manufactures or prepares ice, otherwise than under and in accordance with a licence granted under that Regulation.

schedule.text: WHEREAS [insert name of applicant] has applied to me, [insert name of magistrate], a magistrate, to authorize [him/her*] to enter [insert description of premises or vessel], and I am satisfied by information on oath that there is reasonable ground for entry to [those premises/that vessel*] and that [insert ground on which warrant is issued].
